entities.name: Grapheme Recognition
entities.description: The ability to distinguish between different graphemes, which are the smallest units of written symbols in a language.

entities.name: spoken language
entities.description: The cognitive function that interprets and understands spoken words.

entities.name: multiple
entities.description: Involves various stages and regions of the brain working together.

entities.name: developing brains
entities.description: The developing brains' ability to change and adapt throughout development.

entities.name: PERCEPTION
entities.description: The first stage of language processing, involving the recognition and decoding of speech sounds or written symbols, primarily in the auditory and visual cortices.

entities.name: regions
entities.description: Specific areas of the brain involved in language processing.

entities.name: new words
entities.description: The process of learning and incorporating new lexical items into one's language proficiency.

entities.name: complex
entities.description: A detailed and intricate series of actions.

entities.name: cognition
entities.description: Cognition refers to the mental action or process of acquiring knowledge and understanding through thought, experience, and the senses.

entities.name: involves
entities.description: Involves refers to the complex interplay of neural networks and regions working together in language processing.

entities.name: producing
entities.description: The brain undergoes computations to create meaningful speech.

entities.name: speech
entities.description: Speech involves the perception and production of language through auditory and motor processes.

entities.name: production
entities.description: The process of creating spoken or written language as a response.

entities.name: harmony
entities.description: The coordinated and synchronized interaction between different brain regions during language processing.

entities.name: promises
entities.description: Further exploration and investigation

entities.name: implications
entities.description: Significant effects on language development, communication disorders, and neurorehabilitation strategies.

entities.name: language acquisition
entities.description: The lifelong process of learning and mastering language through understanding words, grammar, and structures.

entities.name: Language Production
entities.description: The ability to produce spoken and written language.

entities.name: lifelong process
entities.description: A continuous activity that spans over an entire lifetime.

entities.name: NEUROREHABILITATION
entities.description: The process of helping individuals recover from neurological conditions, including those affecting language processing.

entities.name: left hemisphere
entities.description: The left side of the brain responsible for various functions including language processing and analytical thinking.

entities.name: deepen
entities.description: To increase understanding to a greater extent.

entities.name: high plasticity
entities.description: High plasticity refers to the brain's ability to change and adapt, especially during development.

entities.name: capacity
entities.description: The ability of the brain to process language and communicate.

entities.name: computations
entities.description: The mental operations by which information is processed and understood.

entities.name: motor areas
entities.description: Areas of the brain involved in movement control.

entities.name: EXPRESSIVE APHASIA
entities.description: A condition resulting from damage to the Broca's area, characterized by difficulty in producing coherent speech.

entities.name: ANGULAR GYRUS
entities.description: A brain region that integrates visual and auditory information to support reading and writing, located in the parietal lobe.

entities.name: research
entities.description: The systematic study of language structure, development, and use.

entities.name: acquisition
entities.description: The process of learning and understanding new languages over a lifetime.

entities.name: children
entities.description: Children who are adept at acquiring new languages due to their developing brain plasticity.

entities.name: sounds
entities.description: Audible waves that are processed by the brain to understand language.

entities.name: production stage
entities.description: The cognitive process of translating understood information into spoken or written responses.

entities.name: MENTAL LEXICON
entities.description: A theoretical construct representing the brain's storage of words and their meanings, which is accessed during language production and comprehension.

entities.name: undergoes
entities.description: The brain processes intricate computations to understand language.

entities.name: perceiving
entities.description: The process by which the brain interprets and understands auditory information as speech sounds.

entities.name: sense
entities.description: The process by which the brain interprets linguistic input and extracts meaning.

entities.name: language structures
entities.description: The system of rules that governs how words are combined to form sentences in a language.

entities.name: understanding
entities.description: The ability to comprehend and interpret information.

entities.name: arcuate fasciculus
entities.description: A bundle of nerve fibers connecting Broca's and Wernicke's areas.

entities.name: learn new languages
entities.description: The process by which individuals, especially children, gain the ability to understand and use a language.

entities.name: COMMUNICATION DISORDERS
entities.description: Conditions that affect the ability to communicate effectively, often related to impairments in language processing.

entities.name: reorganize
entities.description: The process of adjusting and restructuring.

entities.name: conclusion
entities.description: A concise statement encapsulating the main points of an argument, discussion, or report.

entities.name: sentences
entities.description: Sentences are structures composed of words arranged to convey specific meanings.

entities.name: series
entities.description: A sequence of related actions or events

entities.name: disorders
entities.description: Conditions affecting an individual's ability to understand, process, or use language.

entities.name: working
entities.description: Collaborative effort of multiple brain regions

entities.name: adapt to new linguistic input
entities.description: The process by which the brain modifies its structure and function in response to learning new languages.

entities.name: stages
entities.description: Different phases of language processing in the brain.

entities.name: Syntactic Information
entities.description: Syntactic information refers to the rules governing the structure of sentences in a language.

entities.name: meaningful
entities.description: Having clear and understandable significance; not vague.

entities.name: development
entities.description: The process of acquiring language skills and knowledge.

entities.name: Communication
entities.description: Communication is the exchange of information between individuals through speaking, writing, or using some other medium. It is a fundamental aspect of human interaction.

entities.name: nature
entities.description: The natural mental processes by which humans perceive, understand, and respond to information.

entities.name: meaning
entities.description: The interpretation and understanding of linguistic content.

entities.name: grammatical rules
entities.description: Guidelines governing the structure and usage of language.

entities.name: processing
entities.description: The interpretation and manipulation of linguistic information.

entities.name: RESEARCHERS
entities.description: Researchers are individuals who conduct studies and make significant strides in understanding how the brain processes language.
